newsitem.title: PORTUGAL: Westendorp appointed to succeed Bildt - diplomats.
newsitem.headline: Westendorp appointed to succeed Bildt - diplomats.

text.p: The international community on Friday appointed former Spanish foreign minister Carlos Westendorp as the new High Representative for Bosnia to replace the outgoing envoy Carl Bildt, diplomats said.
Westendorp, who will take over on June 20, was appointed after Italy dropped earlier objections, they said.

Bildt, who has said he plans to return to Swedish politics, was appointed the High Representative charged with overseeing the implementation of the civilian aspects of the Dayton peace accords which ended Bosnia's brutal war 18 months ago.

He earlier told reporters his task had been undermined by the failure of the former warring parties to abide by the commitments they had undertaken, but nevertheless said his mission had been a "qualified success".

"We have had 17 months of peace after 44 months of brutal war, the like of which we never thought we would see in Europe in our lifetime," he told reporters on arrival for a meeting of states overseeing Dayton's implementation.
